text.sanskrit: त्वं ह्यग्ने प्रथमो मनोतास्या धियो अभवो दस्म होता ।त्वं सीं वृषन्नकृणोर्दुष्टरीतु सहो विश्वस्मै सहसे सहध्यै ॥
text.iast: tvam  hí  agne  prathamaḥ  manotā  asyāḥ  dhiyaḥ  abhavaḥ  dasma  hotā tvam  sīm  vṛṣan  akṛṇoḥ  dustarītu  sahaḥ  víśvasmai  sahase  sahadhyai ||

translations.text: YouAgni, are the first of the gods; a deity to whom their minds are devoted; plural asing of aspect, you are the invoker of the deities at this rite; showerer (of benefits), bestow upon us unsurpassable strength, where with to sustain all (hostile) prowess.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: अधा होता न्यसीदो यजीयानिळस्पद इषयन्नीड्यः सन् ।तं त्वा नरः प्रथमं देवयंतो महो राये चितयंतो अनु ग्मन् ॥
text.iast: adha  hotā  ní  asīdaḥ  yajīyān  iḷaḥ  pade  iṣayan  īḍyaḥ  san tam  tvā  naraḥ  prathamam  deva-yantaḥ  mahaḥ  rāye  citayantaḥ  anu  gman ||

translations.text: Offerer of the oblation, frequent celebrator of sacrifice, now sit down on the foot-m ark of Iḷā, accepting the (sacrirficial) food, and being glorified; devout men, expectant of great riches, have recourse to you as to the first (of the gods).

text.sanskrit: वृतेव यंतं बहुभिर्वसव्यैस्त्वे रयिं जागृवांसो अनु ग्मन् ।रुशंतमग्निं दर्शतं बृहंतं वपावंतं विश्वहा दीदिवांसं ॥

translations.text: Those who are assiduous in (worshipping) you for riches follow you, going with manyVasusby the path (of the firmament); you, the radiantAgni, of goodly aspect, mighty, fed with burnt-offerings, and blazing every day.

text.sanskrit: पदं देवस्य नमसा व्यंतः श्रवस्यवः श्रव आपन्नमृक्तं ।नामानि चिद्दधिरे यज्ञियानि भद्रायां ते रणयंत संदृष्टौ ॥
text.iast: padam  devasya  namasā  vyantaḥ  śravasyavaḥ  śravaḥ  āpan  amṛktam nāmāni  cit  dadhire  yajñíyāni  bhadrāyām  te  raṇayanta  sam-dṛṣṭau ||

translations.text: Men desirous of food obtain abundance unopposed when repairing to the station of the divinity with oblations; and when delighting,Agni, in your auspicious presence, they repeat those your names which are to be uttered at sacrifices.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: त्वां वर्धंति क्षितयः पृथिव्यां त्वां राय उभयासो जनानां ।त्वं त्राता तरणे चेत्यो भूः पिता माता सदमिन्मानुषाणां ॥

translations.text: Men exalt you upon earth; they exalt you for both kinds of affluence, (cattle and treasure, which you bestow upon) men; you who extricate (us from evil) are to be known as our preserver, as the unfailing father and mother of mankind.

text.sanskrit: सपर्येण्यः स प्रियो विक्ष्वग्निर्होता मंद्रो नि षसादा यजीयान् ।तं त्वा वयं दम आ दीदिवांसमुप ज्ञुबाधो नमसा सदेम ॥
text.iast: saparyeṇyaḥ  saḥ  priyaḥ  vikṣu  agníḥ  hotā  mandraḥ  ní  sasāda  yajīyān tam  tvā  vayam  dame  ā  dīdi-vāṃsam  upa  jñu-bādhaḥ  namasā  sadema ||

translations.text: Agni, who is adorable, affectionate, the offerer of oblations among men, the giver of delight, the celebrator of worship, has sat down (upon the altar); let us approach you, kindled in our dwellings, on bended knees, with praise.

text.sanskrit: तं त्वा वयं सुध्यो नव्यमग्ने सुम्नायव ईमहे देवयंतः ।त्वं विशो अनयो दीद्यानो दिवो अग्ने बृहता रोचनेन ॥

translations.text: Intelligent, hoping for happiness, and devout, we glorify you, adorableAgni; do you, shining with exceeding lustre, lead men to heaven.

text.sanskrit: विशां कविं विश्पतिं शश्वतीनां नितोशनं वृषभं चर्षणीनां ।प्रेतीषणिमिषयंतं पावकं राजंतमग्निं यजतं रयीणां ॥

translations.text: (We glorify) the lord of men of ever-existing men; the wise, the destroyer (of foes) the showerer (of benefits) on mankind, the moving, the bestower of food, the purifier, the resplendent,Agni, who is worshipped for (the sake of) riches.

text.sanskrit: सो अग्न ईजे शशमे च मर्तो यस्त आनट् समिधा हव्यदातिं ।य आहुतिं परि वेदा नमोभिर्विश्वेत्स वामा दधते त्वोतः ॥
text.iast: saḥ  agne  īje  śaśame  ca  martaḥ  yaḥ  te  ānaṭ  sam-ídhā  havya-dātim yaḥ  ā-hutim  pari  veda  namaḥ-bhiḥ  víśvā  ít  saḥ  vāmā  dadhate  tvā-ūtaḥ ||

translations.text: The man,Agni, who worships you, who praises you, who offers oblations to you with kindled fuel, who presents burnt-offerings to you with prostrations, he verily, protected by you, obtains all desired wealth.

text.sanskrit: अस्मा उ ते महि महे विधेम नमोभिरग्ने समिधोत हव्यैः ।वेदी सूनो सहसो गीर्भिरुक्थैरा ते भद्रायां सुमतौ यतेम ॥
text.iast: asmai  ūṃ íti  te  mahi  mahe  vidhema  namaḥ-bhiḥ  agne  sam-ídhā  uta  havyaiḥ vedī  sūno íti  sahasaḥ  gīḥ-bhíḥ  ukthaiḥ  ā  te  bhadrāyām  su-matau  yatema ||

translations.text: To you, mightyAgni, we offer exceeding adoration with prostrations, with fuel, with oblations; (we glorify you) on the altar, son of strength, with hymns and with prayers; may we be successful in our efforts (to gain) you auspicious favour.

text.sanskrit: आ यस्ततंथ रोदसी वि भासा श्रवोभिश्च श्रवस्यस्तरुत्रः ।बृहद्भिर्वाजैः स्थविरेभिरस्मे रेवद्भिरग्ने वितरं वि भाहि ॥
text.iast: ā  yaḥ  tatantha  rodasī íti  ví  bhāsā  śravaḥ-bhiḥ  ca  śravasyaḥ  tarutraḥ bṛhat-bhiḥ  vājaiḥ  sthavirebhiḥ  asme íti  revat-bhiḥ  agne  vi-taram  ví  bhāhi ||

translations.text: Do you,Agni, who have spread heaven and earth with light, who are the preserver (of man), and (who are) to be glorified with praises, shine brightly upon us with abundant food, and with substantial riches.

text.sanskrit: नृवद्वसो सदमिद्धेह्यस्मे भूरि तोकाय तनयाय पश्वः ।पूर्वीरिषो बृहतीरारेअघा अस्मे भद्रा सौश्रवसानि संतु ॥
text.iast: nṛ-vat  vaso íti  sadam  ít  dhehi  asme íti  bhūri  tokāya  tanayāya  paśvaḥ pūrvīḥ  íṣaḥ  bṛhatīḥ  āre-aghāḥ  asme íti  bhadrā  sauśravasāni  santu ||

translations.text: Possessor of wealth, bestow upon us at all times opulence conjoined with dependants, and (grant) abundance of cattle to our sons and grandsons; may therefore be to us abundant food, satisfying our wishes, and free from blame; and may there be auspicious and reputable (means of subsistence).

translations.text: RoyalAgni, may I obtain from you your many and various treasures whereby to be enriched; for, Agni, who are the desired of multitudes, infinite are the riches (aggregated) in you, fit, monarch, for your worshipper.

translations.text: You alight,Agni, likeMitra, upon the oblation offered with the dry fuel; therefore, beholder of all, possessor of riches, you cherish us with food and nourishment.

text.sanskrit: अच्छा नो मित्रमहो देव देवानग्ने वोचः सुमतिं रोदस्योः ।वीहि स्वस्तिं सुक्षितिं दिवो नॄंद्विषो अंहांसि दुरिता तरेम ता तरेम तवावसा तरेम ॥
text.iast: accha  naḥ  mitra-mahaḥ  deva  devān  agne  vocaḥ  su-matím  rodasyoḥ vīhí  svastím  su-kṣitím  divaḥ  nṝn  dviṣaḥ  aṃhāṃsi  duḥ-itā  tarema  tā  tarema  tava  avasā  tarema ||

translations.text: DivineAgni, reverenced as a friend, who are abiding in heaven and earth, communicate our praise to the gods; conduct the offerer of adoration to domestic felicity; and may we overcome our adversaries, our iniquities, our difficulties; may we overcome those (sins of a prior existence); may we overcome them by your protection.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: अग्ने स क्षेषदृतपा ऋतेजा उरु ज्योतिर्नशते देवयुष्टे ।यं त्वं मित्रेण वरुणः सजोषा देव पासि त्यजसा मर्तमंहः ॥
text.iast: agne  saḥ  kṣeṣat  ṛta-pāḥ  ṛte-jāḥ  uru  jyotiḥ  naśate  deva-yuḥ  te yam  tvam  mitreṇa  varuṇaḥ  sa-joṣāḥ  deva  pāsi  tyajasā  martam  aṃhaḥ ||

translations.text: The offerer of sacrifice, born for religious rites, who lives devoted,Agni, to you, obtains abundant light, and is a man whom you, sympathizing in satisfaction withMitraandVaruṇa, protect by your shield from iniquity.

text.sanskrit: ईजे यज्ञेभिः शशमे शमीभिर्ऋधद्वारायाग्नये ददाश ।एवा चन तं यशसामजुष्टिर्नांहो मर्तं नशते न प्रदृप्तिः ॥
text.iast: īje  yajñebhiḥ  śaśame  śamībhiḥ  ṛdhat-vārāya  agnaye  dadāśa eva  cana  tam  yaśasām  ajuṣṭiḥ  na  aṃhaḥ  martam  naśate  na  pra-dṛptiḥ ||

translations.text: He who has presented (oblations) toAgni, the possessor of desired (wealth), sacrifices with (all) sacrifices, and is sanctified by (all) holy acts; him, the wand of excellent (posterity) does not afflict, nor does sin or pride affect a mortal.

text.sanskrit: सूरो न यस्य दृशतिररेपा भीमा यदेति शुचतस्त आ धीः ।हेषस्वतः शुरुधो नायमक्तोः कुत्रा चिद्रण्वो वसतिर्वनेजाः ॥
text.iast: sūraḥ  na  yasya  dṛśatíḥ  arepāḥ  bhīmā  yat  eti  śucataḥ  te  ā  dhīḥ heṣasvataḥ  śurudhaḥ  na  ayam  aktoḥ  kutra  cit  raṇvaḥ  vasatíḥ  vane-jāḥ ||

translations.text: When the fearful flames of you, whose appearance is (as) faultless as (that of) the sun, spread on every side as (if they were) the lowing heifers of the night, then thisAgni, the asylum of all, genitive rated in the woods, is everywhere beautiful.

text.sanskrit: तिग्मं चिदेम महि वर्पो अस्य भसदश्वो न यमसान आसा ।विजेहमानः परशुर्न जिह्वां द्रविर्न द्रावयति दारु धक्षत् ॥

translations.text: Sharp is his path, and his vast body shines like a horse champing fodder with his mouth, darting forth his tongue like a hatchet, and burning timber toashes, like a goldsmith who fuses (metal).

text.sanskrit: स इदस्तेव प्रति धादसिष्यंछिशीत तेजोऽयसो न धारां ।चित्रध्रजतिररतिर्यो अक्तोर्वेर्न द्रुषद्वा रघुपत्मजंहाः ॥
text.iast: saḥ  ít  astā-iva  prati  dhāt  asiṣyan  śíśīta  tejaḥ  ayasaḥ  na  dhārām citra-dhrajatiḥ  aratíḥ  yaḥ  aktoḥ  veḥ  na  dru-sadvā  raghupatma-jaṃhāḥ ||

translations.text: He casts (afar his flames) as an archer (his arrows), and sharpens when about to dart his radiance, as (a warrior whets) the edge of his metal (weapons), he who, variously moving, passes through the night, like the light-falling foot of a bird perched upon a tree.

text.sanskrit: स ईं रेभो न प्रति वस्त उस्राः शोचिषा रारपीति मित्रमहाः ।नक्तं य ईमरुषो यो दिवा नॄनमर्त्यो अरुषो यो दिवा नॄन् ॥
text.iast: saḥ  īm  rebhaḥ  na  prati  vaste  usrāḥ  śocíṣā  rarapīti  mitra-mahāḥ naktam  yaḥ  īm  aruṣaḥ  yaḥ  dívā  nṝn  amartyaḥ  aruṣaḥ  yaḥ  dívā  nṝn ||

translations.text: Like the adorable sun, he clothes himself with brilliant (rays); diffusing friendly light, he crackles with (his fame); (he it is) who is luminous by night, and who lights men (to their work) by day; who is immortal and radiant; who lights men by day.

text.sanskrit: दिवो न यस्य विधतो नवीनोद्वृषा रुक्ष ओषधीषु नूनोत् ।घृणा न यो ध्रजसा पत्मना यन्ना रोदसी वसुना दं सुपत्नी ॥
text.iast: divaḥ  na  yasya  vidhataḥ  navīnot  vṛṣā  rukṣaḥ  oṣadhīṣu  nūnot ghṛṇā  na  yaḥ  dhrajasā  patmanā  yan  ā  rodasī íti  vasunā  dam  supatnī íti su-patnī ||

translations.text: Of whom a sound is heard when scattering his rays like (that) of the sun; the brilliant showerer (of benefits) clamours among the (burning) plural nts; he who, moving not with a shifting, variable motion, but, humbling (our foes), fills the well-wedded earth and heaven with wealth.

text.sanskrit: धायोभिर्वा यो युज्येभिरर्कैर्विद्युन्न दविद्योत्स्वेभिः शुष्मैः ।शर्धो वा यो मरुतां ततक्ष ऋभुर्न त्वेषो रभसानो अद्यौत् ॥
text.iast: dhāyaḥ-bhiḥ  vā  yaḥ  yujyebhiḥ  arkaiḥ  vi-dyut  na  davidyot  svebhiḥ  śuṣmaiḥ śardhaḥ  vā  yaḥ  marutām  tatakṣa  ṛbhuḥ  na  tveṣaḥ  rabhasānaḥ  adyaut ||

translations.text: He who (goes) with sacred (rays), as if with self-harnessed, well-governed (steeds), who shines like lightning with his own scorching (flames), who impairs the vigour of theMaruts, he glows radiant and rapid as the wide-shining sun.

text.sanskrit: यथा होतर्मनुषो देवताता यज्ञेभिः सूनो सहसो यजासि ।एवा नो अद्य समना समानानुशन्नग्न उशतो यक्षि देवान् ॥
text.iast: yathā  hotaḥ  manuṣaḥ  deva-tātā  yajñebhiḥ  sūno íti  sahasaḥ  yajāsi eva  naḥ  adya  samanā  samānān  uśan  agne  uśataḥ  yakṣi  devān ||

translations.text: Son of strength, invoker (of the gods), in like manner as at the worship of the gods byManu, you did offer worship with sacrifice; so now,Agni, with willing mind, worship for us the assenting deities, regarding them as your equals.

text.sanskrit: स नो विभावा चक्षणिर्न वस्तोरग्निर्वंदारु वेद्यश्चनो धात् ।विश्वायुर्यो अमृतो मर्त्येषूषर्भुद्भूदतिथिर्जातवेदाः ॥
text.iast: saḥ  naḥ  vibhā-vā  cakṣaṇiḥ  na  vastoḥ  agníḥ  vandāru  vedyaḥ  canaḥ  dhāt viśva-āyuḥ  yaḥ  amṛtaḥ  martyeṣu  uṣaḥ-bhut  bhūt  atithiḥ  jāta-vedāḥ ||

translations.text: May thatAgni, who, like the illuminator of the day, is resplendent and cognizable (by all), gran us commendable food; he who is the life of all, immortal, who knows all that exists, who is our guest, waking among men at dawn.

text.sanskrit: द्यावो न यस्य पनयंत्यभ्वं भासांसि वस्ते सूर्यो न शुक्रः ।वि य इनोत्यजरः पावकोऽश्नस्य चिच्छिश्नथत्पूर्व्याणि ॥
text.iast: dyāvaḥ  na  yasya  panayanti  abhvam  bhāsāṃsi  vaste  sūryaḥ  na  śukraḥ ví  yaḥ  inoti  ajaraḥ  pāvakaḥ  aśnasya  cit  śiśnathat  pūrvyāṇi ||

translations.text: Whose great deeds his worshipers now celebrate, who is clothed with light, radiant as the sun, exempt from decay, the purifier, he illumes (all things), and destroys the ancient cities of the dispersed (evil beings).

text.sanskrit: वद्मा हि सूनो अस्यद्मसद्वा चक्रे अग्निर्जनुषाज्मान्नं ।स त्वं न ऊर्जसन ऊर्जं धा राजेव जेरवृके क्षेष्यंतः ॥

translations.text: Sons of strength, you are to be praised;Agni, sitting upon the (sacrificial) viands, has given (to his worshippers), from their birth, habitation and food giver of strength, bestow strength upon us; triumph like a prize, so that you may abide in our unassailed (dwelling).

text.sanskrit: नितिक्ति यो वारणमन्नमत्ति वायुर्न राष्ट्र्यत्येत्यक्तून् ।तुर्याम यस्त आदिशामरातीरत्यो न ह्रुतः पततः परिह्रुत् ॥

translations.text: He who whets his (gloom) dispersing (radiance), who eats the (offered) oblation, a soverign likevāyu, overcomes the nights; may we prevail (over him) who is not a donor of the oblations that are due; (Agni), to you, and do you, (swift) as a horse be the destroyer of the foes assailing (us).

translations.text: You over spread,Agni, heaven and earth with radiance, like the sun with his lustrous rays; the wonderful Agni disperses the glooms like the adored (sun) moving on his path, imbued with light.

text.sanskrit: नू नो अग्नेऽवृकेभिः स्वस्ति वेषि रायः पथिभिः पर्ष्यंहः ।ता सूरिभ्यो गृणते रासि सुम्नं मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः ॥

translations.text: Quickly conduct us,Agni, by unmolested paths, to riches and prosperity; (convey us) beyond sin; those delights which you give to your adorers (extend) to him who (now) glorifies you, and may we, living for a hundred winters, and blessed with excellent posterity, be happy.

text.sanskrit: हुवे वः सूनुं सहसो युवानमद्रोघवाचं मतिभिर्यविष्ठं ।य इन्वति द्रविणानि प्रचेता विश्ववाराणि पुरुवारो अध्रुक् ॥

text.sanskrit: युगेयुगे विदथ्यं गृणद्भ्योऽग्ने रयिं यशसं धेहि नव्यसीं ।पव्येव राजन्नघशंसमजर नीचा नि वृश्च वनिनं न तेजसा ॥

translations.text: To those,Agni, who repeat new (praises) to you, the object of their worship from age to age, grant riches and famous (posterity); strike don, undecaying, sovereign, the sinner with your blaze like the thunderbolt, as if he were a tree.

text.sanskrit: नाहं तंतुं न वि जानाम्योतुं न यं वयंति समरेऽतमानाः ।कस्य स्वित्पुत्र इह वक्त्वानि परो वदात्यवरेण पित्रा ॥

translations.text: I understand not the threads (of the warp), nor the threads of the woof, nor that (cloth) which those who are assiduous in united exertion weave; of what (man) may the son declare the words that are to be spoken in the next world, (instrumental ucted) by a father abiding below.

text.sanskrit: मध्ये होता दुरोणे बर्हिषो राळग्निस्तोदस्य रोदसी यजध्यै ।अयं स सूनुः सहस ऋतावा दूरात्सूर्यो न शोचिषा ततान ॥
text.iast: madhye  hotā  duroṇe  barhíṣaḥ  rāṭ  agníḥ  todasya  rodasī íti  yajadhyai ayam  saḥ  sūnuḥ  sahasaḥ  ṛta-vā  dūrāt  sūryaḥ  na  śocíṣā  tatāna ||

translations.text: Agni, the invoker of the gods, the lord of sacrifice, abides in the dwelling of the instrumental tutor of the rite, to offer sacrifice to heaven and earth; he, the son of strength, the observer of truth, has overspread (the world) from afar, like the sun, with light.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: आ यस्मिंत्वे स्वपाके यजत्र यक्षद्राजन्त्सर्वतातेव नु द्यौः ।त्रिषधस्थस्ततरुषो न जंहो हव्या मघानि मानुषा यजध्यै ॥
text.iast: ā  yasmin  tve íti  su  apāke  yajatra  yakṣat  rājan  sarvatātā-iva  nu  dyauḥ tri-sadhasthaḥ  tataruṣaḥ  na  jaṃhaḥ  havyā  maghāni  mānuṣā  yajadhyai ||

translations.text: Adorable and resplendentAgni, to whom, mature in wisdom, the worshipper offers oblations at every sacred rite, do you, who are present in the three (worlds), move with the speed of the traverser (of the sky, the sun), to convey the valuable oblations of men (to the gods).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: तेजिष्ठा यस्यारतिर्वनेराट् तोदो अध्वन्न वृधसानो अद्यौत् ।अद्रोघो न द्रविता चेतति त्मन्नमर्त्योऽवर्त्र ओषधीषु ॥
text.iast: tejiṣṭhā  yasya  aratíḥ  vane-rāṭ  todaḥ  adhvan  na  vṛdhasānaḥ  adyaut adroghaḥ  na  dravitā  cetati  tman  amartyaḥ  avartraḥ  oṣadhīṣu ||

translations.text: He, whose pure and spreading flame blazes in the forest, shines with increasing intensity, like the sun on his (celestial) path; rushing like the innoxious (wind) among the plural nts, immortal, unimpeded, he lights up (all things) by his own (lustre).

text.sanskrit: सास्माकेभिरेतरी न शूषैरग्निः ष्टवे दम आ जातवेदाः ।द्र्वन्नो वन्वन् क्रत्वा नार्वोस्रः पितेव जारयायि यज्ञैः ॥
text.iast: saḥ  asmākebhiḥ  etari  na  śūṣaiḥ  agníḥ  stave  dame  ā  jāta-vedāḥ dru-annaḥ  vanvan  kratvā  na  arvā  usraḥ  pitā-iva  jārayāyi  yajñaiḥ ||

translations.text: Agni, who knows all that exists, is propitiated in our dwelling by our praises, like those gratifying (commendations which proceed) from one soliciting (a favour); feeder upon trees, consumer of forests, impetuous in act as the bull, the (progenitor of calves), he is glorified by the celebration of sacrifices.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: अध स्मास्य पनयंति भासो वृथा यत्तक्षदनुयाति पृथ्वीं ।सद्यो यः स्यंद्रो विषितो धवीयानृणो न तायुरति धन्वा राट् ॥
text.iast: adha  sma  asya  panayanti  bhāsaḥ  vṛthā  yat  takṣat  anu-yāti  pṛthvīm sadyaḥ  yaḥ  syandraḥ  ví-sitaḥ  dhavīyān  ṛṇaḥ  na  tāyuḥ  ati  dhanva  rāṭ ||

translations.text: They glorify his flames in this world; when, easily thinning the woods, they spread over the earth; he, who glides along unarrested, and rapid in movement as a fast flying thief, shines over the desert.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: स त्वं नो अर्वन्निदाया विश्वेभिरग्ने अग्निभिरिधानः ।वेषि रायो वि यासि दुच्छुना मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः ॥
text.iast: saḥ  tvam  naḥ  arvan  nídāyāḥ  víśvebhiḥ  agne  agní-bhiḥ  idhānaḥ veṣi  rāyaḥ  ví  yāsi  ducchunāḥ  madema  śata-himāḥ  su-vīrāḥ ||

translations.text: Quick-movingAgni, kindled with all (your) fires, (guard) us from reproach; you bestow rices, you scattered adversaries; may we, blessed with excellentmaledescendants, enjoy happiness for a hundred winters.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: त्वद्विश्वा सुभग सौभगान्यग्ने वि यंति वनिनो न वयाः ।श्रुष्टी रयिर्वाजो वृत्रतूर्ये दिवो वृष्टिरीड्यो रीतिरपां ॥
text.iast: tvat  víśvā  su-bhaga  saubhagāni  agne  ví  yānti  vanínaḥ  na  vayāḥ śruṣṭī  rayíḥ  vājaḥ  vṛtra-tūrye  divaḥ  vṛṣṭíḥ  īḍyaḥ  rītíḥ  apām ||

translations.text: AuspiciousAgni, all good things proceed from you like branches (from the trunk) of a tree, renowned rices, vigour for the destruction of foes, the rain of heaven; you are to be glorified the sender of the waters.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: त्वं भगो न आ हि रत्नमिषे परिज्मेव क्षयसि दस्मवर्चाः ।अग्ने मित्रो न बृहत ऋतस्यासि क्षत्ता वामस्य देव भूरेः ॥
text.iast: tvam  bhagaḥ  naḥ  ā  hí  ratnam  iṣe  parijmā-iva  kṣayasi  dasma-varcāḥ agne  mitraḥ  na  bṛhataḥ  ṛtasya  asi  kṣattā  vāmasya  deva  bhūreḥ ||

translations.text: Do you, who are adorable, bestow upon us precious wealth; beautiful with radiance, you pass (around) like the circumambient (wind); you, divineAgni, are likemitra, the giver of abundant water and ample wealth.

text.sanskrit: स सत्पतिः शवसा हंति वृत्रमग्ने विप्रो वि पणेर्भर्ति वाजं ।यं त्वं प्रचेत ऋतजात राया सजोषा नप्त्रापां हिनोषि ॥
text.iast: saḥ  sat-patiḥ  śavasā  hanti  vṛtram  agne  vípraḥ  ví  paṇeḥ  bharti  vājam yam  tvam  pra-cetaḥ  ṛta-jāta  rāyā  sa-joṣāḥ  naptrā  apām  hinoṣi ||

translations.text: That man, the protector of the virtuous, destroys,Agni, his enemy by his strength, and baffles, intelligent, the might of (theasura)paṇi, whom you, the wise, the parent of the sacrifice, consentient with the grandson of the waters, encourage (in the hope of) riches.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: यस्ते सूनो सहसो गीर्भिरुक्थैर्यज्ञैर्मर्तो निशितिं वेद्यानट् ।विश्वं स देव प्रति वारमग्ने धत्ते धान्यं पत्यते वसव्यैः ॥
text.iast: yaḥ  te  sūno íti  sahasaḥ  gīḥ-bhíḥ  ukthaiḥ  yajñaiḥ  martaḥ  ní-śitam  vedyā  ānaṭ víśvam  saḥ  deva  prati  vāram  agne  dhatte  dhānyam  patyate  vasavyaiḥ ||

translations.text: The mortal who by praise, by prayers, by sacrifices, attracts, son of strength, your heightened (radiance) to the altar, enjoys all-sufficiency and corn, and abounds in wealth.

text.sanskrit: ता नृभ्य आ सौश्रवसा सुवीराग्ने सूनो सहसः पुष्यसे धाः ।कृणोषि यच्छवसा भूरि पश्वो वयो वृकायारये जसुरये ॥
text.iast: tā  nṛ-bhyaḥ  ā  sauśravasā  su-vīrā  agne  sūno íti  sahasaḥ  puṣyase  dhāḥ kṛṇoṣi  yat  śavasā  bhūri  paśvaḥ  vayaḥ  vṛkāya  araye  jasuraye ||

translations.text: Grant, son of strength, to men (who praise you), those abundant viands and excellent descendants, (that may contribute) to their prosperity; grant also that copious sustenance from cattle, which by your strength you take away from a churlish and malignant adversary.

text.sanskrit: वद्मा सूनो सहसो नो विहाया अग्ने तोकं तनयं वाजि नो दाः ।विश्वाभिर्गीर्भिरभि पूर्तिमश्यां मदेम शतहिमाः सुवीराः ॥
text.iast: vadmā  sūno íti  sahasaḥ  naḥ  ví-hāyāḥ  agne  tokam  tanayam  vājí  naḥ  dāḥ víśvābhiḥ  gīḥ-bhíḥ  abhí  pūrtím  aśyām  madema  śata-himāḥ  su-vīrāḥ ||

translations.text: May the mortal who propitiatesAgniby devotion and worship, together with praises, quickly become distinguished as first (among men), and acquire ample food for the support (of his children).

translations.text: Agniverily is most wise; he is the chief performer of religious rites, a holy sage; the progeny of men glorify Agni as the invoker of the gods at sacrifices.

text.sanskrit: नाना ह्यग्नेऽवसे स्पर्धंते रायो अर्यः ।तूर्वंतो दस्युमायवो व्रतैः सीक्षंतो अव्रतं ॥

translations.text: The manifold treasures of the enemy (detached from them) are emulous,Agni, for the preservation (of your worshippers); men who worship you, triumphing over the spoiler, seek to shame him who celebrates no sacred rite by (their) observances.

text.sanskrit: अग्निरप्सामृतीषहं वीरं ददाति सत्पतिं ।यस्य त्रसंति शवसः संचक्षि शत्रवो भिया ॥

translations.text: Agnibestows (upon his worshippers) amaledescendant, (the performer of good) works, the subduer of foes, the protector of the virtuous, at whose appearance his enemies tremble through fear of his prowess.

text.sanskrit: अग्निर्हि विद्मना निदो देवो मर्तमुरुष्यति ।सहावा यस्यावृतो रयिर्वाजेष्ववृतः ॥

translations.text: The mighty and divineAgni, endowed with knowledge, protects the mortal from reproach whose rich (offerings) are unobstructed (by evil spirits), and unshared by other (offerers) at sacrifices.

text.sanskrit: अच्छा नो मित्रमहो देव देवानग्ने वोचः सुमतिं रोदस्योः ।वीहि स्वस्तिं सुक्षितिं दिवो नॄंद्विषो अंहांसि दुरिता तरेम ता तरेम तवावसा तरेम ॥
text.iast: accha  naḥ  mitra-mahaḥ  deva  devān  agne  vocaḥ  su-matím  rodasyoḥ vīhí  svastím  su-kṣitím  divaḥ  nṝn  dviṣaḥ  aṃhāṃsi  duḥ-itā  tarema  tā  tarema  tava  avasā  tarema ||

translations.text: DivineAgni, revered as a friend, who, abiding in heaven and earth, communicates our praise to the gods, conduct the offerer of adoration to domestic felicity, and may we overcome our adversaries, our iniquities, our difficulties; may we overcome them by your protection.

text.sanskrit: इममू षु वो अतिथिमुषर्बुधं विश्वासां विशां पतिमृंजसे गिरा ।वेतीद्दिवो जनुषा कच्चिदा शुचिर्ज्योक्चिदत्ति गर्भो यदच्युतं ॥
text.iast: imam  ūṃ íti  su  vaḥ  atithim  uṣaḥ-budham  víśvāsām  viśām  patim  ṛñjase  girā veti  ít  divaḥ  januṣā  kat  cit  ā  śuciḥ  jyok  cit  atti  garbhaḥ  yat  acyutam ||

translations.text: Propitiate by praises this guest who wakes at dawn, the cherisher of all people, who on every occasion descends, pure of origin, from heaven, and, present as the embryo (in the wood of attrition), consumes immediately the offered (oblation).

text.sanskrit: मित्रं न यं सुधितं भृगवो दधुर्वनस्पतावीड्यमूर्ध्वशोचिषं ।स त्वं सुप्रीतो वीतहव्ये अद्भुत प्रशस्तिभिर्महयसे दिवेदिवे ॥

translations.text: WonderfulAgni, whom, adorable and upward flaming, thebhṛgusregard as a friend, deposited in the wood of (attrition), be plural ased withvītahavya, since you are glorified by (his) praise everyday.

text.sanskrit: स त्वं दक्षस्यावृको वृधो भूरर्यः परस्यांतरस्य तरुषः ।रायः सूनो सहसो मर्त्येष्वा छर्दिर्यच्छ वीतहव्याय सप्रथो भरद्वाजाय सप्रथः ॥
text.iast: saḥ  tvam  dakṣasya  avṛkaḥ  vṛdhaḥ  bhūḥ  aryaḥ  parasya  antarasya  taruṣaḥ rāyaḥ  sūno íti  sahasaḥ  martyeṣu  ā  chardíḥ  yaccha  vīta-havyāya  sa-prathaḥ  bharat-vājāya  sa-prathaḥ ||

translations.text: Do you, who are unresisted, become the benefactor of him who is skilled (in sacred rites), his defender against a near of distant enemy; son of strength, who are ever renowned, grant wealth and a dwelling tovītahavya, the offerer of the oblation.

text.sanskrit: द्युतानं वो अतिथिं स्वर्णरमग्निं होतारं मनुषः स्वध्वरं ।विप्रं न द्युक्षवचसं सुवृक्तिभिर्हव्यवाहमरतिं देवमृंजसे ॥
text.iast: dyutānam  vaḥ  atithim  svaḥ-naram  agnim  hotāram  manuṣaḥ  su-adhvaram vípram  na  dyukṣa-vacasam  suvṛktí-bhiḥ  havya-vāham  aratím  devam  ṛñjase ||

translations.text: Propitiate with pious praises the radiantAgni, your guest, the guide to heaven, the invoker of the gods( at the sacrifice) ofmanu, the celebrator of holy rites, the speaker of brilliant words like a learned sage, the bearer of oblations (to the gods), the lord, the divine.

text.sanskrit: पावकया यश्चितयंत्या कृपा क्षामन्रुरुच उषसो न भानुना ।तूर्वन्न यामन्नेतशस्य नू रण आ यो घृणे न ततृषाणो अजरः ॥
text.iast: pāvakayā  yaḥ  citayantyā  kṛpā  kṣāman  ruruce  uṣasaḥ  na  bhānunā tūrvan  na  yāman  etaśasya  nu  raṇe  ā  yaḥ  ghṛṇe  na  tatṛṣāṇaḥ  ajaraḥ ||

translations.text: (Propitiate him) who shines upon the earth with purifying and enlightening lustre, as the dawns with ligt; him, who like (a warrior) discomfiting (his foes) quickly blazed forth in the contest in defence ofetaśa; him, who is satiated (with food), exempt from decay.

text.sanskrit: अग्निमग्निं वः समिधा दुवस्यत प्रियंप्रियं वो अतिथिं गृणीषणि ।उप वो गीर्भिरमृतं विवासत देवो देवेषु वनते हि वार्यं देवो देवेषु वनते हि नो दुवः ॥
text.iast: agnim-agnim  vaḥ  sam-ídhā  duvasyata  priyam-priyam  vaḥ  atithim  gṛṇīṣaṇi upa  vaḥ  gīḥ-bhíḥ  amṛtam  vivāsata  devaḥ  deveṣu  vanate  hí  vāryam  devaḥ  deveṣu  vanate  hí  naḥ  duvaḥ ||

translations.text: Worship repeatedly the adorableAgniwith fuel (him) who is ever your dear friend, your guest; approach the immortal Agni with praises, for he, a god among gods, accepts our homage.

text.sanskrit: समिद्धमग्निं समिधा गिरा गृणे शुचिं पावकं पुरो अध्वरे ध्रुवं ।विप्रं होतारं पुरुवारमद्रुहं कविं सुम्नैरीमहे जातवेदसं ॥

translations.text: I glorify with praise the kindledAgni, pure purifying, permanent, (plural ced) before (us) at the sacrifice; let us celebrate with plural asant (hymns) the wise Agni, the invoker of the gods, the adored of many, the benevolent, the far-seeing, him who knows all that exists.

text.sanskrit: त्वां दूतमग्ने अमृतं युगेयुगे हव्यवाहं दधिरे पायुमीड्यं ।देवासश्च मर्तासश्च जागृविं विभुं विश्पतिं नमसा नि षेदिरे ॥

translations.text: You,Agni, have gods and men in every age retained as their messenger, immortal bearer of oblations, beneficent, adorable; they have plural ced him with reverence (upon the altar), vigilant, pervading, the protector of mankind.

text.sanskrit: विभूषन्नग्न उभयाँ अनु व्रता दूतो देवानां रजसी समीयसे ।यत्ते धीतिं सुमतिमावृणीमहेऽध स्मा नस्त्रिवरूथः शिवो भव ॥
text.iast: vi-bhūṣan  agne  ubhayān  anu  vratā  dūtaḥ  devānām  rajasī íti  sam  īyase yat  te  dhītím  su-matím  ā-vṛṇīmahe  adha  sma  naḥ  tri-varūthaḥ  śivaḥ  bhava ||

translations.text: Showing grace,Agni, to both (gods and men), and at each sacred rite the messenger of the gods, you traverse earth and heaven; inasmuch as we offer you worship and praise, therefore do you, who are the guardian of the three (regions), be auspicious to us.

text.sanskrit: तं सुप्रतीकं सुदृशं स्वंचमविद्वांसो विदुष्टरं सपेम ।स यक्षद्विश्वा वयुनानि विद्वान्प्र हव्यमग्निरमृतेषु वोचत् ॥
text.iast: tam  su-pratīkam  su-dṛśam  su-añcam  avidvāṃsaḥ  viduḥ-taram  sapema saḥ  yakṣat  víśvā  vayunāni  vidvān  pra  havyam  agníḥ  amṛteṣu  vocat ||

translations.text: We of little wisdom adore the most wiseAgni, the well-formed, the well-looking the graceful-moving; may Agni, who knows all things that are to be known offer the sacrifice; may he announce the oblation to the immortals.

text.sanskrit: तमग्ने पास्युत तं पिपर्षि यस्त आनट्कवये शूर धीतिं ।यज्ञस्य वा निशितिं वोदितिं वा तमित्पृणक्षि शवसोत राया ॥

translations.text: You cherish, you protect,Agni, that may who offers worship, hero, to you, the far-seeing; you reward with strength and with riches him (who undertakes) the instrumental tution, (who effects) the accomplishments of the sacrifice.

text.sanskrit: त्वमग्ने वनुष्यतो नि पाहि त्वमु नः सहसावन्नवद्यात् ।सं त्वा ध्वस्मन्वदभ्येतु पाथः सं रयिः स्पृहयाय्यः सहस्री ॥

translations.text: Protect us,Agni, from the malignant, preserve us, mighty one, from wickedness; may the offering come to you free from defects; may desirable riches, by your sands, (reach us).

text.sanskrit: अग्निर्होता गृहपतिः स राजा विश्वा वेद जनिमा जातवेदाः ।देवानामुत यो मर्त्यानां यजिष्ठः स प्र यजतामृतावा ॥

text.sanskrit: अग्ने यदद्य विशो अध्वरस्य होतः पावकशोचे वेष्ट्वं हि यज्वा ।ऋता यजासि महिना वि यद्भूर्हव्या वह यविष्ठ या ते अद्य ॥
text.iast: agne  yat  adya  viśaḥ  adhvarasya  hotaríti  pāvaka-śoce  veḥ  tvam  hí  yajvā ṛtā  yajāsi  mahinā  ví  yat  bhūḥ  havyā  vaha  yaviṣṭha  yā  te  adya ||

translations.text: Agni, minister of the sacrifice, bright wiht purifying lustre, approve of that (worship) which is this day celebrated by the instrumental tutor of the rite; you verily are the sacrificer, therefore address the worship (to the gods); and since by your greatness you are all-pervading, therefore, youngest (of the gods), accept the oblations which are today (presented) to you.

translations.text: Look,Agni, upon the (sacrificial) viands duly deposited (upon the altar); heaven and earth detain you to sacrifice (to the gods); opulent Agni, protect us in battle, whereby we may pass safe over all evils; may we pass over those of a prior existence; may we pass over them by your protection.

text.sanskrit: तमु ष्टुहि यो अभिभूत्योजा वन्वन्नवातः पुरुहूत इंद्रः ।अषाळ्हमुग्रं सहमानमाभिर्गीर्भिर्वर्ध वृषभं चर्षणीनां ॥
text.iast: tam  ūṃ íti  stuhi  yaḥ  abhíbhūti-ojāḥ  vanvan  avātaḥ  puru-hūtaḥ  índraḥ aṣāḷham  ugram  sahamānam  ābhíḥ  gīḥ-bhíḥ  vardha  vṛṣabham  carṣaṇīnām ||

translations.text: Praise him who isIndra, the invoker of many, endowed with overpowering vigour, the destroyer (of foes), unharmed by them; exalt with these praises the irresistible, fierce, victorious Indra, the showerer (of benefits) upon mankind.

text.sanskrit: स युध्मः सत्वा खजकृत्समद्वा तुविम्रक्षो नदनुमाँ ऋजीषी ।बृहद्रेणुश्च्यवनो मानुषीणामेकः कृष्टीनामभवत्सहावा ॥

translations.text: He is ever the combatant, the donor, the engaged in battle, the sympathizer (with the sacrificer), the benefactor of many, the loud-sounding, the partaker of the stale libation, the stirrer up of dust (in strife), the chief protector of men the descendants ofManu, the endowed with strength.

text.sanskrit: त्वं ह नु त्यददमायो दस्यूँरेकः कृष्टीरवनोरार्याय ।अस्ति स्विन्नु वीर्यं तत्त इंद्र न स्विदस्ति तदृतुथा वि वोचः ॥

translations.text: You are he who has quickly humbled theDasyus; you are the chief one who has given posterity to theArya;but,Indra, is not verily your power such? If it be not, then in due season confess.

text.sanskrit: सदिद्धि ते तुविजातस्य मन्ये सहः सहिष्ठ तुरतस्तुरस्य ।उग्रमुग्रस्य तवसस्तवीयोऽरध्रस्य रध्रतुरो बभूव ॥
text.iast: sat  ít  hí  te  tuvi-jātasya  manye  sahaḥ  sahiṣṭha  turataḥ  turasya ugram  ugrasya  tavasaḥ  tavīyaḥ  aradhrasya  radhra-turaḥ  babhūva ||

translations.text: Yet, most mighty one, I believe that powre is verily always in you, who are manifest at many rites, and are the enemy of (our) enemies; (the power) that is fierce in the fierce one, most mighty in the mighty one, most unassailable in the subduer (of foes).

text.sanskrit: तन्नः प्रत्नं सख्यमस्तु युष्मे इत्था वदद्भिर्वलमंगिरोभिः ।हन्नच्युतच्युद्दस्मेषयंतमृणोः पुरो वि दुरो अस्य विश्वाः ॥

translations.text: May that our ancient friendship with you ever endure; as when, along with theAṅgirasas, celebrating your praises, you, beautifulIndra, caster down of the immoveable (roks), did verily slayBala, hurling (his darts against you), and force open his cities, and all his gates.

text.sanskrit: स हि धीभिर्हव्यो अस्त्युग्र ईशानकृन्महति वृत्रतूर्ये ।स तोकसाता तनये स वज्री वितंतसाय्यो अभवत्समत्सु ॥

translations.text: FierceIndra, maker of rules you are he who is to be invoked with praise in a great conflict; you are he (who is to be invoked) for sons and grandsons, he, the wielder of the thunderbolt, who is to be especially glorified in battles.

text.sanskrit: स मज्मना जनिम मानुषाणाममर्त्येन नाम्नाति प्र सर्स्रे ।स द्युम्नेन स शवसोत राया स वीर्येण नृतमः समोकाः ॥

translations.text: With immortal, foe-humiliating might he has promoted the (multiplied) birth of mankind; he, the chief of leaders, dwells in the same dwelling with fame, with strength, with riches, with heroism.

text.sanskrit: स यो न मुहे न मिथू जनो भूत्सुमंतुनामा चुमुरिं धुनिं च ।वृणक्पिप्रुं शंबरं शुष्णमिंद्रः पुरां च्यौत्नाय शयथाय नू चित् ॥

translations.text: He who is never perplexed, who is no engenderer of that which is in vain, whose name is renowned, who promptly (exerts himself) for the overturning of the cities (of theasuras), and for the destruction (of his foes); you, (Indra), have indeed slain Cumuri,Dhuni, Pipru,Śambara, andŚuṣṇa.

text.sanskrit: अग्निर्न शुष्कं वनमिंद्र हेती रक्षो नि धक्ष्यशनिर्न भीमा ।गंभीरय ऋष्वया यो रुरोजाध्वानयद्दुरिता दंभयच्च ॥

text.sanskrit: महाँ इंद्रो नृवदा चर्षणिप्रा उत द्विबर्हा अमिनः सहोभिः ।अस्मद्र्यग्वावृधे वीर्यायोरुः पृथुः सुकृतः कर्तृभिर्भूत् ॥

text.sanskrit: यस्ते मदः पृतनाषाळमृध्र इंद्र तं न आ भर शूशुवांसं ।येन तोकस्य तनयस्य सातौ मंसीमहि जिगीवांसस्त्वोताः ॥

translations.text: Bestow upon us,Indra, vigorous strenght, the realizer of wealth, great and propitious, wherewith, thorugh your protection, we may destroy our enemies in battles, whether they be kinsmen or strangers.

translations.text: What is he, theIndrawho has done these deeds? What region does he frequent? Amog what people (does he abide)? What worship, Indra, gives satisfaction to your mind? What praise is able to gratify you? Which of your invokers (is most acceptable to you)?

text.sanskrit: सुत इत्त्वं निमिश्ल इंद्र सोमे स्तोमे ब्रह्मणि शस्यमान उक्थे ।यद्वा युक्ताभ्यां मघवन्हरिभ्यां बिभ्रद्वज्रं बाह्वोरिंद्र यासि ॥

translations.text: Indra, when theSomais being effused, the sacred hymn chanted, the prayer recited, be you prepared (to harness your horses), or,Maghavan, with your horses ready harnessed, come (hither), bearing the thunderbolt in yourhand.

translations.text: Or as, although engaged in heaven in the hero-animating conflict with foes, you protect the offerer of the libation, and humblest, undauntedIndra, theDasyus, the disturbers of the pious and terrified worshipper, (so do you come when thesomais effused.

text.sanskrit: पाता सुतमिंद्रो अस्तु सोमं प्रणेनीरुग्रो जरितारमूती ।कर्ता वीराय सुष्वय उ लोकं दाता वसु स्तुवते कीरये चित् ॥

translations.text: MayIndrabe the drinker of the effusedsoma, he who is the fierce conductor of the worshipper to security; may he be the donor of the world to the presenter of the libation, the giver of wealth to the man who adores him.

translations.text: Favouring Abhyāvartin, the son of Cāyamāna,Indradestroyed the varaśikha (people), killng the descendants of Vṛcīvat, (who were stationed) on the Hariyūpīya, on the eastern part, while the western (troop) was scattered through fear.

text.sanskrit: सत्यमित्तन्न त्वावाँ अन्यो अस्तींद्र देवो न मर्त्यो ज्यायान् ।अहन्नहिं परिशयानमर्णोऽवासृजो अपो अच्छा समुद्रं ॥

translations.text: Verily it is the truth,Indra, that there is no other such as you, no god nor mortal is (your) superior; you have slain Ahi obstructing the waters, you have set them free (to flow) to the ocean.

text.sanskrit: त्वमपो वि दुरो विषूचीरिंद्र दृळ्हमरुजः पर्वतस्य ।राजाभवो जगतश्चर्षणीनां साकं सूर्यं जनयंद्यामुषासं ॥

translations.text: You have set the obstructed waters free o flow in all directions; you have fractured the solid (barrier) of the cloud; you are lord over the people of the world, making manifest together the sun, the sky, and the dawn.

text.sanskrit: अभूरेको रयिपते रयीणामा हस्तयोरधिथा इंद्र कृष्टीः ।वि तोके अप्सु तनये च सूरेऽवोचंत चर्षणयो विवाचः ॥
text.iast: abhūḥ  ekaḥ  rayi-pate  rayīṇām  ā  hastayoḥ  adhithāḥ  indra  kṛṣṭīḥ ví  toke  ap-su  tanaye  ca  sūre  avocanta  carṣaṇayaḥ  ví-vācaḥ ||

translations.text: You, lord of riches, are the chief (soverign) over riches; you hold men in your twohands, and men glorify you with various praises for (the sake of obtaining) sons, and valiant grandsons, and rain.

text.sanskrit: त्वद्भियेंद्र पार्थिवानि विश्वाच्युता चिच्च्यावयंते रजांसि ।द्यावाक्षामा पर्वतासो वनानि विश्वं दृळ्हं भयते अज्मन्ना ते ॥

translations.text: Through fear of you,Indra, all the regions of the firmamet cause the unfallen (rain) to descend; the heavens, the earth, the mountains, the forests, all the solid (universe) is alarmed at your approach.

text.sanskrit: त्वं कुत्सेनाभि शुष्णमिंद्राशुषं युध्य कुयवं गविष्टौ ।दश प्रपित्वे अध सूर्यस्य मुषायश्चक्रमविवे रपांसि ॥

translations.text: You have destroyed the hundred impregnable cities of theDasyu,Śambara, when sagaciousIndra, you, who are brought by the libation, have bestowed in your liberality riches uponDivodāsapresenting to you libations, and uponBharadvājahymning your praise.

text.sanskrit: स सत्यसत्वन्महते रणाय रथमा तिष्ठ तुविनृम्ण भीमं ।याहि प्रपथिन्नवसोप मद्रिक्प्र च श्रुत श्रावय चर्षणिभ्यः ॥
text.iast: saḥ  satya-satvan  mahate  raṇāya  ratham  ā  tiṣṭha  tuvi-nṛmṇa  bhīmam yāhí  pra-pathin  avasā  upa  madrík  pra  ca  śruta  śravaya  carṣaṇí-bhyaḥ ||

translations.text: Leader of true heroes, possessor of infinite wealth, mount your formidable car for the arduous conflict; come to me, pursuer of a forward path, for my protection; do you who are renowned, proclaim (our renown) among men.

text.sanskrit: स मातरा सूर्येणा कवीनामवासयद्रुजदद्रिं गृणानः ।स्वाधीभिर्ऋक्वभिर्वावशान उदुस्रियाणामसृजन्निदानं ॥
text.iast: saḥ  mātarā  sūryeṇa  kavīnām  avāsayat  rujat  adrim  gṛṇānaḥ su-ādhībhiḥ  ṛkva-bhiḥ  vāvaśānaḥ  ut  usríyāṇām  asṛjat  ni-dānam ||

translations.text: He has obtained the parent (worlds, heaven and earth), with the sun, for the sake of the sages, (heaṅgirasas), and, glorified (by them), he has shattered the mountain; repeatedly wished for by his adorers intently meditating (upon him), he has cast off the fetters of the kine.

text.iast: saḥ  vahni-bhiḥ  ṛkva-bhiḥ  goṣu  śaśvat  mitajñu-bhiḥ  puru-kṛtvā  jigāya puraḥ  puraḥ-hā  sakhi-bhiḥ  sakhi-yan  dṛḷhāḥ  ruroja  kaví-bhiḥ  kavíḥ  san ||

text.sanskrit: स सर्गेण शवसा तक्तो अत्यैरप इंद्रो दक्षिणतस्तुराषाट् ।इत्था सृजाना अनपावृदर्थं दिवेदिवे विविषुरप्रमृष्यं ॥

text.sanskrit: य ओजिष्ठ इंद्र तं सु नो दा मदो वृषन्त्स्वभिष्टिर्दास्वान् ।सौवश्व्यं यो वनवत्स्वश्वो वृत्रा समत्सु सासहदमित्रान् ॥

text.sanskrit: स त्वं न इंद्राकवाभिरूती सखा विश्वायुरविता वृधे भूः ।स्वर्षाता यद्ध्वयामसि त्वा युध्यंतो नेमधिता पृत्सु शूर ॥

text.sanskrit: कदा भुवन्रथक्षयाणि ब्रह्म कदा स्तोत्रे सहस्रपोष्यं दाः ।कदा स्तोमं वासयोऽस्य राया कदा धियः करसि वाजरत्नाः ॥

translations.text: When may our prayers (be with you) in your chariot? When will you grant to your adorer the (means of) maintaining thousands? When will you recompense my adoration with riches? When will you render sacred rites productive of food?

translations.text: Sound loud against the (hostile) host; animate our prowess; thunder aloud, terrifying the evil-minded; rapid, drum, those whose delight is to harm us; you are the fist ofIndra; inspire us with fierceness.

translations.text: Recover these our cattle,Indra; bring them back; the drum sounds repeatedly as a signal; our leaders, mounted on their steeds, assemble; may our warriors, riding in their cars, Indra, be victorious.

text.iast: ā  yaḥ  paprau  bhānunā  rodasī íti  ubhe íti  dhūmena  dhāvate  diví tiraḥ  tamaḥ  dadṛśe  ūrmyāsu  ā  śyāvāsu  aruṣaḥ  vṛṣā  ā  śyāvāḥ  aruṣaḥ  vṛṣā ||

translations.text: He who fills both heaven and earth with light, who mounts with smoke into the sky, this radiant showerer (of benefits) is beheld in the dark nights dispersing the gloom; this radiant showerer (of benefits) presides over the dark nights.

text.iast: víśvāsām  gṛha-patiḥ  viśām  asi  tvam  agne  mānuṣīṇām śatam  pūḥ-bhíḥ  yaviṣṭha  pāhi  aṃhasaḥ  sam-eddhāram  śatam  hímāḥ  stotṛ-bhyaḥ  ye  ca  dadati ||

text.sanskrit: ओमानमापो मानुषीरमृक्तं धात तोकाय तनयाय शं योः ।यूयं हि ष्ठा भिषजो मातृतमा विश्वस्य स्थातुर्जगतो जनित्रीः ॥
text.iast: omānam  āpaḥ  mānuṣīḥ  amṛktam  dhāta  tokāya  tanayāya  śam  yoḥ yūyam  hí  stha  bhiṣajaḥ  mātṛ-tamāḥ  víśvasya  sthātuḥ  jagataḥ  janitrīḥ ||

translations.text: Waters, friendly to mankind, grant uninterrupted (life) preserving (food) for (the perpetuation of our) sons and grandsons; grant us security and the removal (of all evil), for you are more than maternal physicians; you are the parents of the stationary and moveable universe.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: आ नो देवः सविता त्रायमाणो हिरण्यपाणिर्यजतो जगम्यात् ।यो दत्रवाँ उषसो न प्रतीकं व्यूर्णुते दाशुषे वार्याणि ॥
text.iast: ā  naḥ  devaḥ  savitā  trāyamāṇaḥ  híraṇya-pāṇiḥ  yajataḥ  jagamyāt yaḥ  datra-vān  uṣasaḥ  na  pratīkam  vi-ūrṇute  dāśuṣe  vāryāṇi ||

translations.text: May the adorable, golden-handedSavitā, the preserver, come to us; he, the munificent, who, like the opening of the dawn, displays desirable (riches) to the offerer of the oblation.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: उत त्वं सूनो सहसो नो अद्या देवाँ अस्मिन्नध्वरे ववृत्याः ।स्यामहं ते सदमिद्रातौ तव स्यामग्नेऽवसा सुवीरः ॥
text.iast: uta  tvam  sūno íti  sahasaḥ  naḥ  adya  ā  devān  asmín  adhvare  vavṛtyāḥ syām  aham  te  sadam  ít  rātau  tava  syām  agne  avasā  su-vīraḥ ||

translations.text: And do you, son of strength, bring back today the deities to this our sacrifice; may  I be ever in (the enoyment of) your bounty; may I, through your protection,Agni, be blessed with excellentmaledescendants.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: उत त्या मे हवमा जग्म्यातं नासत्या धीभिर्युवमंग विप्रा ।अत्रिं न महस्तमसोऽमुमुक्तं तूर्वतं नरा दुरितादभीके ॥
text.iast: uta  tyā  me  havam  ā  jagmyātam  nāsatyā  dhībhíḥ  yuvam  aṅga  viprā atrim  na  mahaḥ  tamasaḥ  amumuktam  tūrvatam  narā  duḥ-itāt  abhīke ||

translations.text: WiseNāsatyāscome quickly to my invocation (united) with holy acts; (extricate us) from thick darkness, as you did extricateAtri; protect us, leaders (of rites) from danger in battle.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: ते नो रायो द्युमतो वाजवतो दातारो भूत नृवतः पुरुक्षोः ।दशस्यंतो दिव्याः पार्थिवासो गोजाता अप्या मृळता च देवाः ॥
text.iast: te  naḥ  rāyaḥ  dyu-mataḥ  vāja-vataḥ  dātāraḥ  bhūta  nṛ-vataḥ  puru-kṣoḥ daśasyantaḥ  divyāḥ  pārthivāsaḥ  go-jātāḥ  apyāḥ  mṛḷata  ca  devāḥ ||

translations.text: Be unto us, gods, donors of splendid, invigorating riches, comprisingmaledescendants, and celebrated by many; celestialĀdityas, terrestrialVasus, offspring ofPṛśni, children of the waters, granting our desires, make us happy.

text.sanskrit: ते नो रुद्रः सरस्वती सजोषा मीळ्हुष्मंतो विष्णुर्मृळंतु वायुः ।ऋभुक्षा वाजो दैव्यो विधाता पर्जन्यावाता पिप्यतामिषं नः ॥
text.iast: te  naḥ  rudraḥ  sarasvatī  sa-joṣāḥ  mīḷhuṣmantaḥ  víṣṇuḥ  mṛḷantu  vāyuḥ ṛbhukṣāḥ  vājaḥ  daivyaḥ  vi-dhātā  parjanyāvātā  pipyatām  íṣam  naḥ ||

translations.text: MayRudraandSarasvatī, alike well plural ased andViṣṇuandVāyu, make us happy, sending rain; and Ribhukṣin, andVāja, and the divineVidhātā; and mayParjanyaandVātagrant us abundant food.

text.sanskrit: उत स्य देवः सविता भगो नोऽपां नपादवतु दानु पप्रिः ।त्वष्टा देवेभिर्जनिभिः सजोषा द्यौर्देवेभिः पृथिवी समुद्रैः ॥
text.iast: uta  syaḥ  devaḥ  savitā  bhagaḥ  naḥ  apām  napāt  avatu  dānu  papriḥ tvaṣṭā  devebhiḥ  jani-bhiḥ  sa-joṣāḥ  dyauḥ  devebhiḥ  pṛthivī  samudraiḥ ||

translations.text: And may the divineSavitāandBhaga, and the grandson of the waters, (Agni), the prodigal of gifts, preserve us; and mayTvaṣṭāwith the gods, and Earth with the seas, (preserve us).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: उत नोऽहिर्बुध्न्यः शृणोत्वज एकपात्पृथिवी समुद्रः ।विश्वे देवा ऋतावृधो हुवानाः स्तुता मंत्राः कविशस्ता अवंतु ॥
text.iast: uta  naḥ  ahiḥ  budhnyaḥ  śṛṇotu  ajaḥ  eka-pāt  pṛthivī  samudraḥ víśve  devāḥ  ṛta-vṛdhaḥ  huvānāḥ  stutāḥ  mantrāḥ  kavi-śastāḥ  avantu ||

translations.text: MayAhirbudhnya, Aja-ekapād, and Earth and Ocean, hear us; may the universal gods, who are exalted by sacrifice, they who are invoked and praised (by us), to whom mystical prayers are addressed, and who have been glorified by (ancient) sages, preserve us.

text.sanskrit: एवा नपातो मम तस्य धीभिर्भरद्वाजा अभ्यर्चंत्यर्कैः ।ग्ना हुतासो वसवोऽधृष्टा विश्वे स्तुतासो भूता यजत्राः ॥
text.iast: eva  napātaḥ  mama  tasya  dhībhíḥ  bharat-vājāḥ  abhí  arcanti  arkaiḥ gnāḥ  hutāsaḥ  vasavaḥ  adhṛṣṭāḥ  víśve  stutāsaḥ  bhūta  yajatrāḥ ||

translations.text: Thus do my sons, of the race ofBharadvāja, worship the gods with sacred rites and holy hymns; and so, adorable (deities), may you, who are worshipped and glorified, the givers of dwellings, the invincible, universal gods, ever be adored, (together with your) wives.

text.sanskrit: उदु त्यच्चक्षुर्महि मित्रयोराँ एति प्रियं वरुणयोरदब्धं ।ऋतस्य शुचि दर्शतमनीकं रुक्मो न दिव उदिता व्यद्यौत् ॥

translations.text: The expansive, illuminating, unobstructive, pure, and beautiful radiance of the sun, grateful toMitraandVaruṇa, having risen, shines like the ornament of the sky.

text.sanskrit: वेद यस्त्रीणि विदथान्येषां देवानां जन्म सनुतरा च विप्रः ।ऋजु मर्तेषु वृजिना च पश्यन्नभि चष्टे सूरो अर्य एवान् ॥

translations.text: He who knows the three cognizable (worlds); the sage (who knows) the mysterious birth of the divinities (abiding in them); he who is beholding the good and evil acts of mortals, he, the sun, the lord, makes manifest their intentions.

text.sanskrit: स्तुष उ वो मह ऋतस्य गोपानदितिं मित्रं वरुणं सुजातान् ।अर्यमणं भगमदब्धधीतीनच्छा वोचे सधन्यः पावकान् ॥

text.sanskrit: रिशादसः सत्पतीँरदब्धान्महो राज्ञः सुवसनस्य दातॄन् ।यूनः सुक्षत्रान्क्षयतो दिवो नॄनादित्यान्याम्यदितिं दुवोयु ॥

text.sanskrit: द्यौष्पितः पृथिवि मातरध्रुगग्ने भ्रातर्वसवो मृळता नः ।विश्व आदित्या अदिते सजोषा अस्मभ्यं शर्म बहुलं वि यंत ॥

text.sanskrit: मा नो वृकाय वृक्ये समस्मा अघायते रीरधता यजत्राः ।यूयं हि ष्ठा रथ्यो नस्तनूनां यूयं दक्षस्य वचसो बभूव ॥

translations.text: Subject us not, adorable (deities), to the robber or his wife; not to any one designing us harm; for you are the regulators of our person ns, of our strength, of our speech.

text.sanskrit: मा व एनो अन्यकृतं भुजेम मा तत्कर्म वसवो यच्चयध्वे ।विश्वस्य हि क्षयथ विश्वदेवाः स्वयं रिपुस्तन्वं रीरिषीष्ट ॥

text.sanskrit: नम इदुग्रं नम आ विवासे नमो दाधार पृथिवीमुत द्यां ।नमो देवेभ्यो नम ईश एषां कृतं चिदेनो नमसा विवासे ॥

translations.text: Reverence be to the potent (company of universal gods); I offer (them) reverence; reverence sustains both earth and heaven; revernce be to the gods; reverence is sovereign over them; I expiate by reverence whatever sin may have been committed.

text.sanskrit: शुक्रं ते अन्यद्यजतं ते अन्यद्विषुरूपे अहनी द्यौरिवासि ।विश्वा हि माया अवसि स्वधावो भद्रा ते पूषन्निह रातिरस्तु ॥

translations.text: One of your forms, (Pūṣan), is luminous, one is venerable; so that the day is variously complexioned; for you are like the sun; verily, bestower of food, you protect all intelligence; may your auspicious liberality be manifested on this occasion.

translations.text: With thos your golden vessels, which navigate within the ocean-firmament, you discharge the office of messenger of the sun; desirous of the sacrificial food, you are propitiated by (that which is) willingly offered.

text.sanskrit: ता हि क्षत्रं धारयेथे अनु द्यूंदृंहेथे सानुमुपमादिव द्योः ।दृळ्हो नक्षत्र उत विश्वदेवो भूमिमातांद्यां धासिनायोः ॥

translations.text: You manifest vigour daily, you strengthen the summit of the sky as if with a pillar; the solid firmamen and the universal deity (the sun) replenish earth and heaven with the food of man.

text.sanskrit: ता विग्रं धैथे जठरं पृणध्या आ यत्सद्म सभृतयः पृणंति ।न मृष्यंते युवतयोऽवाता वि यत्पयो विश्वजिन्वा भरंते ॥
text.iast: tā  vigram  dhaithe íti  jaṭharam  pṛṇadhyai  ā  yat  sadma  sa-bhṛtayaḥ  pṛṇanti na  mṛṣyante  yuvatayaḥ  avātāḥ  ví  yat  payaḥ  viśva-jinvā  bharante ||

translations.text: You two support the sage (worshipper), filling his belly when he and his dependants fill the sacrificial chamber; when sustainers of all, the rain (is sent down by you), and the young (rivers) are not obstructed, but, undried, diffuse (fertility) around.

text.sanskrit: ता जिह्वया सदमेदं सुमेधा आ यद्वां सत्यो अरतिर्ऋते भूत् ।तद्वां महित्वं घृतान्नावस्तु युवं दाशुषे वि चयिष्टमंहः ॥
text.iast: tā  jihvayā  sadam  ā  idam  su-medhāḥ  ā  yat  vām  satyaḥ  aratíḥ  ṛte  bhūt tat  vām  mahi-tvam  ghṛta-annau  astu  yuvam  dāśuṣe  ví  cayiṣṭam  aṃhaḥ ||

translations.text: The wise man always (solicits) you his prayers for this (supply of water), when approaching you sincer in sacrifice; may your magnanimity be such that you, the feeders upon ghī, may exterminate sin in the donor (of the oblation);

text.sanskrit: प्र यद्वां मित्रावरुणा स्पूर्धन्प्रिया धाम युवधिता मिनंति ।न ये देवास ओहसा न मर्ता अयज्ञसाचो अप्यो न पुत्राः ॥
text.iast: pra  yat  vām  mitrāvaruṇā  spūrdhan  priyā  dhāma  yuva-dhitā  minanti na  ye  devāsaḥ  ohasā  na  martāḥ  ayajña-sācaḥ  apyaḥ  na  putrāḥ ||

translations.text: (Exterminate also),MitraandVaruṇathose who emulously contending, disturb the rites that are agreeable and beneficial to you both; those divinities, those mortals, who are not diligent in adoration, those who performing works perform not sacrifices, those who do not propitiate you.

text.sanskrit: अवोरित्था वां छर्दिषो अभिष्टौ युवोर्मित्रावरुणावस्कृधोयु ।अनु यद्गावः स्फुरानृजिप्यं धृष्णुं यद्रणे वृषणं युनजन् ॥
text.iast: avoḥ  itthā  vām  chardíṣaḥ  abhíṣṭau  yuvoḥ  mitrāvaruṇau  askṛdhoyu anu  yat  gāvaḥ  sphurān  ṛjipyam  dhṛṣṇum  yat  raṇe  vṛṣaṇam  yunajan ||

translations.text: Upon your approach,MitraandVaruṇa, protectors of the dwelling, your (bounty) is unlimited; when (your) praises are uttered, and the sacrificers add in the ceremony theSomathat inspires straightforwardness and resoluion, and is the showerer (of benefits).

text.sanskrit: श्रुष्टी वां यज्ञ उद्यतः सजोषा मनुष्वद्वृक्तबर्हिषो यजध्यै ।आ य इंद्रावरुणाविषे अद्य महे सुम्नाय मह आववर्तत् ॥

translations.text: MightyIndraandVaruṇa, promptly has theSomareturned, engaged conscientiously (with the priests) to offer sacrifice to you to obtain food for him by whom, likeManu, the sacred grass has been clipped; he who (invited you hither) today for exceeding happiness.

text.sanskrit: ता हि श्रेष्ठा देवताता तुजा शूराणां शविष्ठा ता हि भूतं ।मघोनां मंहिष्ठा तुविशुष्म ऋतेन वृत्रतुरा सर्वसेना ॥

translations.text: You two are the principal (divinities) at the worship of the gods; the distributors of wealth; the most vigorous of heroes; the most liberal among the opulent; possessed of vast strength; destroyers of foes by truth; entire hosts (of yourselves).

text.sanskrit: इंद्रावरुणा सुतपाविमं सुतं सोमं पिबतं मद्यं धृतव्रता ।युवो रथो अध्वरं देववीतये प्रति स्वसरमुप याति पीतये ॥

text.sanskrit: सं वां कर्मणा समिषा हिनोमींद्राविष्णू अपसस्पारे अस्य ।जुषेथां यज्ञं द्रविणं च धत्तमरिष्टैर्नः पथिभिः पारयंता ॥

text.sanskrit: आ वामश्वासो अभिमातिषाह इंद्राविष्णू सधमादो वहंतु ।जुषेथां विश्वा हवना मतीनामुप ब्रह्माणि शृणुतं गिरो मे ॥
text.iast: ā  vām  aśvāsaḥ  abhimāti-sahaḥ  índrāviṣṇū íti  sadha-mādaḥ  vahantu juṣethām  víśvā  havanā  matīnām  upa  brahmāṇi  śṛṇutam  gíraḥ  me ||

translations.text: May your equaly-spirited steeds,IndraandViṣṇu, the triumphant over enemies, bear you hither, be plural ased with all the invocations of your worshippers; hear my prayers and praises.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: इंद्राविष्णू तत्पनयाय्यं वां सोमस्य मद उरु चक्रमाथे ।अकृणुतमंतरिक्षं वरीयोऽप्रथतं जीवसे नो रजांसि ॥
text.iast: índrāviṣṇū íti  tat  panayāyyam  vām  somasya  made  uru  cakramāthe íti akṛṇutam  antarikṣam  varīyaḥ  aprathatam  jīvase  naḥ  rajāṃsi ||

translations.text: IndraandViṣṇu, that (exploit) is to be glorified, by which, in the exhilaration of theSoma, you have strode over the wide (space); you have traversed the wide firmament; you have declared the worlds (fit) for our existence.

text.sanskrit: इंद्राविष्णू हविषा वावृधानाग्राद्वाना नमसा रातहव्या ।घृतासुती द्रविणं धत्तमस्मे समुद्रः स्थः कलशः सोमधानः ॥
text.iast: índrāviṣṇū íti  havíṣā  vavṛdhānā  agra-advānā  namasā  rāta-havyā ghṛtāsutī íti ghṛta-āsutī  draviṇam  dhattam  asme íti  samudraḥ  sthaḥ  kalaśaḥ  soma-dhānaḥ ||

translations.text: IndraandViṣṇu, feeders upon clarified butter, drinkers of he fermentedSoma, thriving upon oblations, accepting them offered with reverence, bestow upon us wealth; for you are an ocean, a pitcher, the receptacle of the libation.

text.sanskrit: इंद्राविष्णू पिबतं मध्वो अस्य सोमस्य दस्रा जठरं पृणेथां ।आ वामंधांसि मदिराण्यग्मन्नुप ब्रह्माणि शृणुतं हवं मे ॥
text.iast: índrāviṣṇū íti  píbatam  madhvaḥ  asya  somasya  dasrā  jaṭharam  pṛṇethām ā  vām  andhāṃsi  madirāṇi  agman  upa  brahmāṇi  śṛṇutam  havam  me ||

translations.text: IndraandViṣṇu, agreeable of aspect, drink of this sweetSoma; fill with it your bellies; may the inebriating Soma reach you; hear my prayers, my invocation.

text.sanskrit: उभा जिग्यथुर्न परा जयेथे न परा जिग्ये कतरश्चनैनोः ।इंद्रश्च विष्णो यदपस्पृधेथां त्रेधा सहस्रं वि तदैरयेथां ॥
text.iast: ubhā  jigyathuḥ  na  parā  jayethe íti  na  parā  jigye  kataraḥ  cana  enoḥ índraḥ  ca  viṣṇo íti  yat  apaspṛdhethām  tredhā  sahasram  ví  tat  airayethām ||

translations.text: You have both (ever) been victorious; never have been conquered; neither of you two has been vanquished; with whomsoever you have contended you have thrice conquered thousands.

text.sanskrit: घृतवती भुवनानामभिश्रियोर्वी पृथ्वी मधुदुघे सुपेशसा ।द्यावापृथिवी वरुणस्य धर्मणा विष्कभिते अजरे भूरिरेतसा ॥
text.iast: ghṛtavatī íti ghṛta-vatī  bhuvanānām  abhi-śríyā  urvī íti  pṛthvī íti  madhudughe íti madhu-dughe  su-peśasā dyāvāpṛthivī íti  varuṇasya  dharmaṇā  vískabhite íti ví-skabhite  ajare íti  bhūri-retasā ||

translations.text: Radiant Heaven and Earth, the asylum of created beings, you are spacious, manifold, water-yielding, lovely, separately fixed by the functions ofVaruṇa, undecaying, many-germed.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: असश्चंती भूरिधारे पयस्वती घृतं दुहाते सुकृते शुचिव्रते ।राजंती अस्य भुवनस्य रोदसी अस्मे रेतः सिंचतं यन्मनुर्हितं ॥
text.iast: asaścantī íti  bhūridhāre íti bhūri-dhāre  payasvatī íti  ghṛtam  duhāte íti  su-kṛte  śucivrate íti śuci-vrate rājantī íti  asya  bhuvanasya  rodasī íti  asme íti  retaḥ  siñcatam  yat  manuḥ-hitam ||

translations.text: Uncollapsing, many-showering, water retaining, yielding moisture, beneficent, pure in act; do you two, Heaven and Earth, rulers over created beings, grant us vigour, that may be favourable to (the increase of) mankind.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: यो वामृजवे क्रमणाय रोदसी मर्तो ददाश धिषणे स साधति ।प्र प्रजाभिर्जायते धर्मणस्परि युवोः सिक्ता विषुरूपाणि सव्रता ॥
text.iast: yaḥ  vām  ṛjave  kramaṇāya  rodasī íti  martaḥ  dadāśa  dhiṣaṇe íti  saḥ  sādhati pra  pra-jābhiḥ  jāyate  dharmaṇaḥ  pari  yuvoḥ  siktā  víṣu-rūpāṇi  sa-vratā ||

translations.text: Firm-set Heaven and Earth, the mortal who has offered (oblations) for your straight-forward course, accomplishes (his objects), he prospers with progeny, and invigorated by your operation, many beings of various forms, but similar functions, are engendeed.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: घृतेन द्यावापृथिवी अभीवृते घृतश्रिया घृतपृचा घृतावृधा ।उर्वी पृथ्वी होतृवूर्ये पुरोहिते ते इद्विप्रा ईळते सुम्नमिष्टये ॥
text.iast: ghṛtena  dyāvāpṛthivī íti  abhīvṛte ítyabhí-vṛte  ghṛta-śríyā  ghṛta-pṛcā  ghṛta-vṛdhā urvī íti  pṛthvī íti  hotṛ-vūrye  purohite íti puraḥ-hite  te íti  ít  víprāḥ  īḷate  sumnam  iṣṭaye ||

translations.text: You are surrounded, Heaven and Earth, by water; you are the asylum of water; imbued with water; the augmenters of water; vast and manifold; you are first propitiated in the sacrifice; the pious pray to you for happiness, that the sacrifice (may be celebrated).
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: मधु नो द्यावापृथिवी मिमिक्षतां मधुश्चुता मधुदुघे मधुव्रते ।दधाने यज्ञं द्रविणं च देवता महि श्रवो वाजमस्मे सुवीर्यं ॥
text.iast: madhu  naḥ  dyāvāpṛthivī íti  mimikṣatām  madhu-ścutā  madhudughe íti madhu-dughe  madhuvrate íti madhu-vrate dadhāne íti  yajñam  draviṇam  ca  devatā  mahi  śravaḥ  vājam  asme íti  su-vīryam ||

translations.text: May Heaven and Earth, the effusers of water, the milkers of water, dischargers of the functions of water, divinities, the promoters of sacrifice, the bestowers of wealth, of renown, of food, ofmaleposterity, combine together.

text.sanskrit: ऊर्जं नो द्यौश्च पृथिवी च पिन्वतां पिता माता विश्वविदा सुदंससा ।संरराणे रोदसी विश्वशंभुवा सनिं वाजं रयिमस्मे समिन्वतां ॥
text.iast: ūrjam  naḥ  dyauḥ  ca  pṛthivī  ca  pinvatām  pitā  mātā  viśva-vídā  su-daṃsasā saṃrarāṇe íti sam-rarāṇe  rodasī íti  viśva-śambhuvā  saním  vājam  rayím  asme íti  sam  invatām ||

translations.text: May father Heaven, may mother Earth, who are all-knowing, and doers of good deeds, grant us sustenance; may Heaven and Earth, mutually co-operating and promoting the happiness of all, bestow upon us posterity, food, and riches.

text.sanskrit: उदु ष्य देवः सविता हिरण्यया बाहू अयंस्त सवनाय सुक्रतुः ।घृतेन पाणी अभि प्रुष्णुते मखो युवा सुदक्षो रजसो विधर्मणि ॥
text.iast: ut  ūṃ íti  syaḥ  devaḥ  savitā  hiraṇyayā  bāhū íti  ayaṃsta  savanāya  su-kratuḥ ghṛtena  pāṇī íti  abhí  pruṣṇute  makhaḥ  yuvā  su-dakṣaḥ  rajasaḥ  ví-dharmaṇi ||

translations.text: The divine and benevolentSavitāputs forth his golden arms for (making) donations; the adorable, youthful, sagacious (deity), stretches out hishands, filled with water, in the various services of the world.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: देवस्य वयं सवितुः सवीमनि श्रेष्ठे स्याम वसुनश्च दावने ।यो विश्वस्य द्विपदो यश्चतुष्पदो निवेशने प्रसवे चासि भूमनः ॥
text.iast: devasya  vayam  savituḥ  savīmani  śreṣṭhe  syāma  vasunaḥ  ca  dāvane yaḥ  víśvasya  dvi-padaḥ  yaḥ  catuḥ-padaḥ  ni-veśane  pra-save  ca  asi  bhūmanaḥ ||

translations.text: May we be among the progeny of the divineSavitā, and (have power) to offer him most excellent donations; for you are he who (are absolute) in the procreation and perpetuation of many (living beings), bipeds and quadrupeds.

text.sanskrit: अदब्धेभिः सवितः पायुभिष्ट्वं शिवेभिरद्य परि पाहि नो गयं ।हिरण्यजिह्वः सुविताय नव्यसे रक्षा माकिर्नो अघशंस ईशत ॥
text.iast: adabdhebhiḥ  savitaríti  pāyu-bhiḥ  tvam  śivebhiḥ  adya  pari  pāhi  naḥ  gayam híraṇya-jihvaḥ  suvitāya  navyase  rakṣa  mākiḥ  naḥ  agha-śaṃsaḥ  īśata ||

translations.text: Do you,Savitā, posper today our dwelling with uninjurable protections, confirming happiness; do you, who are golden-tongued, (be vigilant) for our present prosperity; protect us; let not any calumniator have power (to harm) us.

text.sanskrit: उदु ष्य देवः सविता दमूना हिरण्यपाणिः प्रतिदोषमस्थात् ।अयोहनुर्यजतो मंद्रजिह्व आ दाशुषे सुवति भूरि वामं ॥
text.iast: ut  ūṃ íti  syaḥ  devaḥ  savitā  damūnāḥ  híraṇya-pāṇiḥ  prati-doṣam  asthāt ayaḥ-hanuḥ  yajataḥ  mandra-jihvaḥ  ā  dāśuṣe  suvati  bhūri  vāmam ||

translations.text: May the divine, munificent, golden-handed, golden-jawed, adorable, sweet-spokenSavitā, rise regularly at the close of night; when he besows abundant and desirable (food) upon the donor of the oblation.

translations.text: MaySavitāput forth like an orator his golden well-formed arms; (he who), from the ends of the earth, ascends to the summit of the sky, and, moving along, delights every thing that is.

text.sanskrit: वाममद्य सवितर्वाममु श्वो दिवेदिवे वाममस्मभ्यं सावीः ।वामस्य हि क्षयस्य देव भूरेरया धिया वामभाजः स्याम ॥
text.iast: vāmam  adya  savitaḥ  vāmam  ūṃ íti  śvaḥ  dive-dive  vāmam  asmabhyam  sāvīḥ vāmasya  hí  kṣayasya  deva  bhūreḥ  ayā  dhiyā  vāma-bhājaḥ  syāma ||

translations.text: Beget for us,Savitā, wealth today, wealth tomorrow, wealth day by day; you are the giver of ample wealth, of a (spacious) mansion; may we, by this praise, become partakers of wealth.

text.sanskrit: इंद्रासोमा महि तद्वां महित्वं युवं महानि प्रथमानि चक्रथुः ।युवं सूर्यं विविदथुर्युवं स्वर्विश्वा तमांस्यहतं निदश्च ॥
text.iast: índrāsomā  mahi  tat  vām  mahi-tvam  yuvam  mahāni  prathamāni  cakrathuḥ yuvam  sūryam  vividathuḥ  yuvam  svaḥ  víśvā  tamāṃsi  ahatam  nidaḥ  ca ||

translations.text: Great,IndraandSoma, is that your greatness, for you have made great and principal (beings); you have made known (to men)Sūryaand the waters; you have dissipated the glooms and (desroyed) the revilers.

text.sanskrit: इंद्रासोमावहिमपः परिष्ठां हथो वृत्रमनु वां द्यौरमन्यत ।प्रार्णांस्यैरयतं नदीनामा समुद्राणि पप्रथुः पुरूणि ॥

text.sanskrit: इंद्रासोमा युवमंग तरुत्रमपत्यसाचं श्रुत्यं रराथे ।युवं शुष्मं नर्यं चर्षणिभ्यः सं विव्यथुः पृतनाषाहमुग्रा ॥

translations.text: IndraandSoma, do you promptly bestow upon us preservative, renowned (riches), accompanied by offspring; for you, fierce (divinities), have disseminated among men, strength, useful to man, victorious over hostile acts.

text.sanskrit: यो अद्रिभित्प्रथमजा ऋतावा बृहस्पतिरांगिरसो हविष्मान् ।द्विबर्हज्मा प्राघर्मसत्पिता न आ रोदसी वृषभो रोरवीति ॥
text.iast: yaḥ  adri-bhít  prathama-jāḥ  ṛta-vā  bṛhaspatiḥ  āṅgirasaḥ  havíṣmān dvibarha-jmā  prāgharma-sat  pitā  naḥ  ā  rodasī íti  vṛṣabhaḥ  roravīti ||

translations.text: Bṛhaspati, who is the breaker of the mountain, the first-born (ofPrajāpati), the observer of truth, the descendant ofAṅgirasa, the partaker of the oblation, the traverser of two worlds, abiding in the region of light, is to us a father; he, the showerer, hunders and in heaven and earth.

text.iast: janāya  cit  yaḥ  īvate  ūṃ íti  lokam  bṛhaspatiḥ  deva-hūtau  cakāra ghnan  vṛtrāṇi  ví  puraḥ  dardarīti  jayan  śatrūn  amítrān  pṛt-su  sahan ||

translations.text: Bṛhaspati, who has appointed a region for the man who attends diligently at divine worship, destroying impediments, conquering foes, overcoming enemies, demolished various cities (of theasuras).

translations.text: ThisBṛhaspatihas conquered the treasures (of the enemy), and the spacious pastures with the cattle; purposing to appropriate he waters (of the firmament), he destroys with sacred prayers the adversary of heaven.

text.sanskrit: सोमारुद्रा धारयेथामसुर्यं प्र वामिष्टयोऽरमश्नुवंतु ।दमेदमे सप्त रत्ना दधाना शं नो भूतं द्विपदे शं चतुष्पदे ॥

translations.text: SomaandRudra, confirm (in us the strength) ofasurasmay sacrifices in every dwelling adequately reach you; do you, possessors of the seven precious things, besow happiness upon us; happiness upon our bipeds and quadrupeds.

text.sanskrit: सोमारुद्रा वि वृहतं विषूचीममीवा या नो गयमाविवेश ।आरे बाधेथां निर्ऋतिं पराचैरस्मे भद्रा सौश्रवसानि संतु ॥
text.iast: somārudrā  ví  vṛhatam  víṣūcīm  amīvā  yā  naḥ  gayam  ā-viveśa āre  bādhethām  níḥ-ṛtim  parācaiḥ  asme íti  bhadrā  sauśravasāni  santu ||

translations.text: SomaandRudra, expel the widespread sickness that has entered into our dwellings; keep offNirṛti, so that she may be far away, and may prosperous means of sustenance be ours.

translations.text: SomaandRudra, grant all these medicamens for (the ailments of) our bodies; detach, set free, the perpetrated iniquity that has been bound up in our person ns.

text.sanskrit: तिग्मायुधौ तिग्महेती सुशेवौ सोमारुद्राविह सु मृळतं नः ।प्र नो मुंचतं वरुणस्य पाशाद्गोपायतं नः सुमनस्यमाना ॥

translations.text: Sharp-weaponed, sharp-arrowed,  profoundly-honouredSomaandRudra, grant us happiness in this world; propitiated by our praise, preserve us; liberate us from the bonds ofVaruṇa.

text.sanskrit: जीमूतस्येव भवति प्रतीकं यद्वर्मी याति समदामुपस्थे ।अनाविद्धया तन्वा जय त्वं स त्वा वर्मणो महिमा पिपर्तु ॥
text.iast: jīmūtasya-iva  bhavati  pratīkam  yat  varmī  yāti  sa-madām  upa-sthe anāviddhayā  tanvā  jaya  tvam  saḥ  tvā  varmaṇaḥ  mahimā  pipartu ||

translations.text: When the mailed warrior advances in the front of battles, his form is like that of a cloud; with his body unwounded do you conquer; may the strength of the armous defend us.

text.sanskrit: धन्वना गा धन्वनाजिं जयेम धन्वना तीव्राः समदो जयेम ।धनुः शत्रोरपकामं कृणोति धन्वना सर्वाः प्रदिशो जयेम ॥

translations.text: May we conquer the cattle (of the enemies) with the bow; with the bow may we be victorious in battle may we overcome our fierce-exulting (enemies) with the bow; may the bow disappoint the hope of the foe; may we subdue with the bow all (hostile) countries.

translations.text: This bowstring, drawn tight upon the bow, and making way in battle, repeatedly approaches the ear (of the warrior), as if embracing its friend (the arrow), and proposing to say something agreeable, as a woman whispers (to her husband).

translations.text: May the two extremities of the bow, acting in concert, like a wife sympathizing (with her husband), uphold (the warrior), as a mother nurses her child upon her lap; and may they, moving concurrently, and harassing the foe, scatter his enemies.

text.sanskrit: आलाक्ता या रुरुशीर्ष्ण्यथो यस्या अयो मुखं ।इदं पर्जन्यरेतस इष्वै देव्यै बृहन्नमः ॥
text.iast: āla-aktā  yā  ruru-śīrṣṇī  atho íti  yasyāḥ  ayaḥ  mukham idam  parjanya-retase  íṣvai  devyai  bṛhat  namaḥ ||

translations.text: This praise (be offered) to the large celestial arrow, the growth ofParjanya, whose point is anointed with venom, whose blade is iron.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: अवसृष्टा परा पत शरव्ये ब्रह्मसंशिते ।गच्छामित्रान्प्र पद्यस्व मामीषां कं चनोच्छिषः ॥
text.iast: ava-sṛṣṭā  parā  pata  śaravye  brahma-saṃśite gaccha  amítrān  pra  padyasva  mā  amīṣām  kam  cana  ut  śiṣaḥ ||

translations.text: Arrow, wheted by charms, fly when discharged; go light among the adversaries, spare not one of the enemy.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: यत्र बाणाः संपतंति कुमारा विशिखा इव ।तत्रा नो ब्रह्मणस्पतिरदितिः शर्म यच्छतु विश्वाहा शर्म यच्छतु ॥
text.iast: yatra  bāṇāḥ  sam-patanti  kumārāḥ  viśikhāḥ-iva tatra  naḥ  brahmaṇaḥ  patiḥ  aditiḥ  śarma  yacchatu  viśvāhā  śarma  yacchatu ||

translations.text: Where arrows alight like shaven-headed boys maybrahmaṇaspati, mayAditi, grant us happiness every day.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: मर्माणि ते वर्मणा छादयामि सोमस्त्वा राजामृतेनानु वस्तां ।उरोर्वरीयो वरुणस्ते कृणोतु जयंतं त्वानु देवा मदंतु ॥
text.iast: marmāṇi  te  varmaṇā  chādayāmi  somaḥ  tvā  rājā  amṛtena  anu  vastām uroḥ  varīyaḥ  varuṇaḥ  te  kṛṇotu  jayantam  tvā  anu  devāḥ  madantu ||

translations.text: I cover your vital parts with armour; may the royalSomainvest you with ambrosia; mayVaruṇaamplify your ample felicity; may the gods rejoice (at beholding you) triumphant.
Griffith translation not found for this verse.

text.sanskrit: यो नः स्वो अरणो यश्च निष्ट्यो जिघांसति ।देवास्तं सर्वे धूर्वंतु ब्रह्म वर्म ममांतरं ॥
text.iast: yaḥ  naḥ  svaḥ  araṇaḥ  yaḥ  ca  níṣṭyaḥ  jíghāṃsati devāḥ  tam  sarve  dhūrvantu  brahma  varma  mama  antaram ||

translations.text: Whoever, whether an unfriendly relative or a stranger, desires to kill us, may all the gods destroy him; prayer is my best armour
